title: PHPExceptiongetTraceAsString() Method

metadata.description: Learn about PHPExceptiongetTraceAsString() Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Output the stack trace:
<?php
function myFunction($num) {
throw new Exception("An error 
  occurred");
}
try {
myFunction(5);
} catch (Exception 
  $e) {
print_r($e->getTraceAsString());
}
?>

Definition and Usage
The
getTraceAsString()
method returns a stack trace in the form of a string.
Stack traces contain information about all of the functions that are running at a given
moment. The stack trace provided by this method has information about the stack at the
time that the exception was thrown.
Syntax
$exception->getTraceAsString()
Technical Details
Return Value:
Returns a stack trace in the form of a string
Related Pages
Read more about Exceptions in our
PHP Exceptions Chapter
.
PHP Reference: The
getTrace()
Method.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPExceptiongetTraceAsString() Method concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPExceptiongetTraceAsString() Method effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPExceptiongetTraceAsString() Method and how to apply it in your projects.
